title: From Hey Siri to Hey Subbu? Apple hires Amar Subramanya, taking a bite out of Google via Microsoft
content: Apple has hired Google veteran Amar Subramanya as its new VP of AI to bolster its lagging ambitions. Subramanya, who previously led AI efforts at Microsoft, brings expertise in foundation models and machine learning. This move highlights the intense talent war in Silicon Valley as Apple seeks to catch up with rivals in the AI race.

title: Breakfast meet 2.0: Karnataka power tussle still unsettled; DKS and Siddaramaiah hold meet again
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah visited Deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar's residence for breakfast on December 2. This meeting follows recent discussions to strengthen their collective efforts for the state. The leaders aim to present a united front ahead of the Belagavi legislature session. This breakfast meeting signals a pause in the ongoing leadership discussions within the ruling party.

title: Faulty batteries, no backup: How Chennai Metro plunged into early-morning chaos; video goes viral
content: Around 25 commuters were stranded in a Chennai metro train for nearly 30 minutes in an underground tunnel early Tuesday. The train stopped due to a dual battery failure in its controlling units, forcing passengers to walk to the High Court station. Normal operations resumed shortly after.

title: Imran Khan supporters plan major protest in Rawalpindi amid death rumours — 10 things to know
content: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan's prolonged isolation has sparked fears of his death, with his party demanding access.  Despite government restrictions and Section 144 enforcement, PTI plans protests outside Islamabad High Court and Adiala Jail.  Khan's family reports no verifiable contact, fearing the worst.  Officials deny rumors of his demise or transfer, stating he is in stable condition and receiving care in Adiala Jail.

title: Glenn Maxwell opts out of IPL 2026; pens emotional goodbye to fans
content: Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has withdrawn from the IPL 2026 auction, concluding his impactful league journey. This decision follows a disappointing IPL 2025 season with Punjab Kings, where he scored only 48 runs in seven matches. Maxwell's exit joins a trend of prominent overseas players opting out of the upcoming tournament.

title: Workplace success: Satya Nadella says 'can't rely on brains alone'; reveals 'best tool'
content: In a world increasingly dominated by artificial intelligence, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella argues that emotional intelligence is essential for business leaders. He posits that while AI can manage technical tasks, the human touch—through empathy and collaboration—remains irreplaceable in driving success.

title: Ranveer Singh apologises over claims he insulted Goddess Chamundadevi in ‘Kantara 1’
content: Ranveer Singh has apologized for remarks made at IFFI 2025, where he mistakenly referred to a goddess as a 'female ghost' while praising Rishabh Shetty's 'Kantara' performance. Hindu groups filed a complaint, alleging insult to Goddess Chamundadevi. Singh clarified his intent was admiration and expressed deep respect for all beliefs, offering a sincere apology for any hurt caused.

title: Bajaj Housing Finance share tumbles 9% to hit 52-week low - what triggered the fall?
content: Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit a 52-week low on Tuesday following reports of a block deal where promoter Bajaj Finance is believed to have offloaded a 2.35% stake. Despite steady financial performance and an 18% profit rise in Q2FY26, the stock has fallen 23% since its September 2024 listing.

title: Gold price prediction: Will prices rise in the near-term? Top factors to keep in mind
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are poised for a near-term rise, driven by surging expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut and ongoing economic concerns. Analysts highlight strong ETF inflows and a potential all-time high for gold, while silver also shows significant gains amid inventory shortages and a favorable gold-silver ratio.

title: 'We are in deep trouble': How US is lagging behind China - Ford CEO explains
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical US trade worker shortage, leaving 1 million jobs unfilled. He highlights a dangerous gap compared to China in building essential workforces, impacting national security. Farley advocates for rebuilding the blue-collar pipeline through education and cultural respect, citing Ford's recent union agreements as a step towards career stability for workers.

title: Sanjay Kapur property feud: Instead of mourning, Priya sought control of assets, alleges Rani
content: Delhi High Court heard arguments over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore will. His mother, Rani Kapur, alleges his wife, Priya Kapur, rushed to control assets instead of mourning. Rani claims she was excluded from the will despite Sunjay's acknowledgment of her support. The court is also considering an injunction sought by Sunjay's children from his marriage to Karisma Kapoor.

title: Bengaluru: Airport café staff booked over worm in food, youth alleges false extortion case
content: A 19-year-old has filed a complaint against an airport restaurant five months after allegedly finding a worm in his food. He claims the establishment then falsely accused him of extortion. Police found no evidence of extortion by the youth, and a case has now been registered against the restaurant for food adulteration and other charges.

title: Gurdaspur 'grenade attack': UP hairdresser among 3 held; link to Pak-backed terror module
content: Delhi Police detained a 24-year-old hairdresser from Bijnor, Mohd Arish, for alleged links to a hand-grenade attack in Gurdaspur. He is among three suspects accused of being part of a terror module run by Pakistan-based gangster Shahzad Bhatti. Investigations revealed illegal weapon sales and incriminating chat messages.

title: Gmail hack: Declutter your Google storage; how to keep your inbox running smoothly
content: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: These guys deserve better! Ex-selectors say Rohit & Virat must stop being put on trial
content: Former selectors and experts urge Indian cricket to end the constant scrutiny of Rohit and Virat, highlighting their continued capability. Despite recent performances, the team management's approach to the 2027 World Cup preparation, particularly regarding the captaincy transition, has caused unease. Clear communication and a defined plan are crucial for the veterans and the team's future.

title: Bangladesh: BNP hails PM Modi's concern for critical former PM Khaleda Zia
content: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern and offered support for former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia, who is in critical condition. The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) conveyed sincere gratitude for Modi's thoughtful message and goodwill. Zia, a prominent political figure, is currently on ventilation at a Dhaka hospital due to a deteriorating health condition.

title: 'He scored a hundred in T20… now he’ll play Tests': Ashwin takes sharp dig at Agarkar
content: Abhimanyu Easwaran is a consistent performer in Indian domestic cricket. He has scored many runs in the Ranji Trophy. However, a Test debut remains elusive. Despite being in squads, he has been overlooked. Easwaran recently showed T20 aggression with a century. This has sparked discussion about his potential selection for the Test team.

title: Karnataka TET Hall Ticket 2025 out: Download admit card now
content: The Karnataka Department of School Education has released the KARTET 2025 hall tickets for the December 7th examination. Candidates can download their admit cards online from sts.karnataka.gov.in and must carry a printed copy along with a valid photo ID to the exam centre. The admit card contains crucial details like exam centre, timing, and personal information.

title: Student found dead at KIIT-Bhubaneswar: Mother alleges ‘harassment over relationship’; police scan chats
content: An 18-year-old student was discovered deceased in his hostel room in KIIT, prompting police to suspect suicide. This incident is the third of its kind this year. The grieving mother has pointed fingers at a girl from Chhattisgarh and her family for alleged harassment, which she believes contributed to her son taking the step.

title: 'When facts ran thin, theatrics stepped in': Cong targets govt, ED over National Herald case
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge slammed the Modi government for a fresh FIR in the National Herald case, calling it a political vendetta against the Gandhi family. The BJP countered, demanding explanations for alleged "loot by its leaders" and stating the case predates the current administration. The Congress maintains the ED is conducting a politically motivated witch hunt.

title: BLF claims it used woman fidayeen to storm Pak FC HQ; site tied to Chinese project
content: In a significant shift, the Baloch Liberation Front deployed a female suicide bomber, Zareena Rafiq, to attack a Chinese-linked mining complex in Balochistan. This marks the BLF's first use of a fidayeen operative, a tactic previously exclusive to the BLA.

title: Drake Maye readies for Giants as wife Ann’s viral gym photo stuns Patriots fans
content: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is electrifying fans with his stellar performance, leading the team to a dominant 10-2 record. Off the field, his wife, Ann Michael Maye, is gaining a significant following on TikTok for her fitness and lifestyle content. Their combined popularity makes them a notable NFL power couple.

title: Nishant Agarwal to walk free in BrahMos spy case; Pak’s ‘Neha’, ‘Pooja’ targeted more scientists
content: A former BrahMos Aerospace scientist, Nishant Agarwal, has been cleared of espionage and cyber terrorism charges by the Bombay High Court. While exonerated of passing missile secrets, he was convicted for possessing classified information on a personal device, receiving a three-year sentence. Having already served longer, his release is anticipated.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs tipped to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
content: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.

title: ‘Looks like the CEO shooter’: 911 call by McDonald's worker played during Luigi Mangione hearing
content: A Manhattan judge reviewed crucial evidence in the murder case of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including a 911 call from the McDonald's where Luigi Mangione was arrested. Prosecutors presented surveillance footage of the shooting. Mangione's defense is challenging the legality of the search and seizure of evidence, while supporters rallied outside.

title: 'Personal trainer, top-class facilities': Steyn reveals Kohli’s preparation routine in London
content: Virat Kohli's exceptional 135 against South Africa silenced form concerns. Former Proteas bowler Dale Steyn revealed Kohli's elite conditioning stems from training at top London facilities with a personal trainer. Kohli himself emphasized his mental approach and consistent physical fitness over excessive preparation, showcasing his professionalism.

title: Trump says US freeze on asylum decisions will last ‘a long time’
content: Following a fatal shooting near the White House, President Trump announced a prolonged pause on asylum decisions, particularly for nationals from 19 countries. He stated, "We don’t want those people," citing concerns about their suitability for entry. The incident involved an Afghan national, arrested and charged with murder, who had arrived under a resettlement program.

title: Sanjay Kapur's mother, Rani Kapur, supports Karisma
content: A significant legal battle has erupted over the Rs 30,000 crore estate of the late Sunjay Kapur. His mother, Rani Kapur, has now joined Karisma Kapoor and her children in challenging Sunjay's will. Rani questions the will's authenticity, stating it's improbable Sunjay would disinherit his mother and leave everything to his widow, Priya Sachdev.

title: Europeans rally round Ukraine, Trump envoy heads to Moscow
content: European leaders rallied behind Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, supporting his peace proposal revisions after US-Ukrainian talks. While US envoy Steve Witkoff heads to Moscow to brief the Kremlin, Russia continues its attacks on Ukrainian cities, claiming territorial gains amidst ongoing negotiations.

title: IPL auction: 1,355 players register for 77 slots; event on December 16
content: Over 1,300 players, including prominent Indian and international stars, have registered for the IPL mini-auction in Abu Dhabi, setting the stage for intense bidding. With 77 slots available and teams holding substantial funds, the December 16 event promises a thrilling competition for coveted IPL contracts.

title: ‘Cruel, inhumane’: Mamdani slams ICE raids; reveals what he told Trump when he met him
content: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani denounced federal immigration raids as "cruel and inhumane," stating they do not enhance public safety. His comments followed a violent confrontation in lower Manhattan where protesters clashed with federal agents, leading to over a dozen arrests. Mamdani emphasized his commitment to protecting all city residents, including immigrants.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Investors can consider buying Ashok Leyland, HCL Tech, and Bank of Baroda on December 2, 2025.  Ashok Leyland is expected to break a triangle pattern upwards. HCL Tech is poised to resume its uptrend after consolidation. Bank of Baroda is showing a range breakout with positive momentum.

title: ‘Waah India Post!’ Video of parcels being thrown on railway tracks in UP sparks outrage
content: Shocking visuals emerged from Pratapgarh Railway Station showing India Post workers tossing mail bags onto tracks. The incident, captured on video, sparked widespread outrage online. India Post has acknowledged the mishandling and initiated action against the involved personnel and supervisors. They have also requested the railways for a ramp to ensure proper mail movement.

title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs look in love while celebrating his birthday on Instagram
content: Cardi B delighted fans by sharing glimpses of Stefon Diggs' birthday. A custom Snoopy football cake, celebrating his jersey number, stole the show. Later, a video captured the couple joyfully rapping and dancing in a car, radiating pure, unadulterated fun. This intimate peek into their celebration resonated deeply, earning them 'relationship goals' praise.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Govt orders handset makers to preload its Sanchar Saathi app
content: Smartphone manufacturers must now pre-install the government's Sanchar Saathi app on all devices sold in India. This mandate, effective within 90 days, aims to bolster cyber security and prevent IMEI tampering. However, privacy advocates express strong concerns, viewing it as an invasion of personal space and a potential threat to user data.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex near 85,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Tuesday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 was above 26,150, BSE Sensex was near 85,500.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Chennai, suburbs wake to season’s wettest morning; schools, colleges closed
content: Cyclone Ditwah, after weakening, surprised Chennai with a deluge on Monday morning, causing widespread flooding and traffic disruptions. The India Meteorological Department issued orange and red alerts for the city and Tiruvallur respectively. Weathermen predict continued heavy rain for the region as the system lingers offshore.

title: 35 years on, CBI arrests Yasin aide wanted for Rubaiya abduction
content: A suspect, wanted for 35 years in the 1989 abduction of Rubaiya Sayeed, has been arrested by the CBI. Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, with a Rs 10 lakh bounty, allegedly conspired with jailed JKLF chief Yasin Malik. Rubaiya Sayeed identified Malik as one of her captors in court.

title: 'Emotions run high': 2011 World Cup winner’s blunt reminder to Gambhir as criticism mounts
content: Despite an ODI win, coach Gautam Gambhir faces intense fan criticism after a Test series whitewash.  Former player Zaheer Khan advises Gambhir to develop resilience and communicate transparently with supporters regarding team strategies and selections to manage rising expectations and frustration.

title: IITs bar from placement drive 20+ companies that rescinded offers
content: Over 20 companies have been banned from participating in the IIT placement season for revoking job offers made to students, some as late as June or July. This decision was made unanimously by IITs to protect students' career prospects and mental well-being. The banned firms can still recruit through off-campus processes.

title: ‘Don’t want a slave’s peace’: Maduro hits back at Trump's 'leave Venezuela' threat; tensions escalate
content: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro rejected a "slave's peace" amid escalating US pressure, accusing Washington of testing the nation with a prolonged naval deployment.  Reports suggest President Trump issued an ultimatum for Maduro to step down, which was reportedly refused. The US has intensified military pressure in the Caribbean, with strikes targeting suspected drug-carrying boats.

title: Sunjay Kapur property row: Not mentioned in will, mother Rani Kapur joins forces with Karisma Kapoor
content: A bitter inheritance battle has erupted over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore estate. His mother, Rani Kapur, has joined forces with his ex-wife Karisma Kapoor, challenging the validity of his will. They allege Sunjay's wife, Priya, is attempting to seize assets and question the will's authenticity, claiming it omits key family members and assets.

title: Samantha-Raj wedding: Friend shares inside pics
content: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru exchanged vows in a sacred Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha ceremony at the Isha Yoga Center. The 'Citadel' couple celebrated their union with close friends and family, later sharing joyous glimpses of the intimate event, including their traditional vegetarian thali reception.

title: 'We are ready': BSF warns of 120 terrorists on LoC launch pads; cautious with Op Sindoor phase 2
content: BSF Kashmir IG Ashok Yadav stated that "120 terrorists" on 69 launch pads across the LoC are under close watch, with Operation Sindoor ready for activation if Pakistan attempts any "misadventure." Following Indian strikes, Pakistan shifted some launch pads deeper, but they remain under surveillance. Infiltration attempts have significantly dropped this year.

title: Giants bench Carter again at start of MNF loss
content: Giants first-round pick Abdul Carter didn't start or play early in Monday night's matchup with the Patriots due to a "coach's decision."

title: Sources: BYU coach Sitake focus of PSU search
content: The Penn State coaching search, which has gone quiet in the past few weeks, has focused on BYU coach Kalani Sitake, sources told ESPN on Monday, confirming a report by On3.

title: Sources: Mets give D. Williams 3-year, $51M deal
content: The New York Mets and reliever Devin Williams agreed to a three-year, $51 million deal, league sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan Monday night, giving the club a replacement for Edwin Diaz should the All-Star closer sign elsewhere.

title: Kiffin ready to make LSU nation's 'best program'
content: A day after flying out of Oxford, Mississippi, Lane Kiffin was introduced as LSU coach Monday, promising to restore the Tigers to being "the best program in all of college football," while detailing his excruciating decision to leave Ole Miss.

title: Michigan State hires Fitzgerald, touts 'new era'
content: Former Northwestern coach Pat Fitzgerald was hired Monday as the new football coach at Michigan State. Sources told ESPN that it's a five-year deal.

title: Sources: WNBA offering max salary base of $1M
content: The WNBA's latest proposal to the players' union includes a maximum salary base of $1 million, sources told ESPN's Alexa Philippou. The new offer reflects incremental increases from the league's previous proposal.

title: Miami AD: ACC should revisit tiebreaker system
content: A four-game winning streak might not be enough for 10-2 Miami to make the College Football Playoff, and Hurricanes athletic director Dan Radakovich told ESPN the ACC should revisit its tiebreaker system to ensure the league "puts its best foot forward."

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin left an actual playoff team for a theoretical one. He should be honest about why
content: Lane Kiffin might be a great coach, but he isn't being treated unfairly by Ole Miss or "the calendar" or anything else.

title: Four intriguing divisions, 10 teams and playoffs on the line: Barnwell makes sense of close races
content: It feels like every division is still up for grabs this season. Let's take a closer look at particularly tight races in the NFC West, NFC South, AFC South and AFC North.

title: 'When do we get our Siakam?': What to make of the Bulls' uneven early season
content: From a 6-1 start to a 9-10 record to begin December, which Chicago Bulls team is the real version and what could be next?

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Wolverines on the rise
content: The fourth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: UConn still the team to beat
content: The fourth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Welcome to NFL draft season: 30 questions on the QBs, standout prospects and risers to watch
content: Who's in the hunt to go No. 1? How does the QB class look? Which teams need defense? And who could rise at the combine? Let's answer big questions on this class.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have draft notes, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look ahead to Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: Buzz: Justin Herbert set for surgery, but aims to play in Week 14
content: Herbert set for surgery, Meyers keeps producing for the Jaguars and Irving looked good in his return in Week 14

title: Chelsea, Arsenal put on a show of title hopefuls, Xabi Alonso's Madrid mess, more
content: Sunday's clash between Premier League title chasers lived up to expectations with drama, controversy and grit. PLUS: Xabi Alonso's tactics lead to Madrid losing more points, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: How do Barça contain Atlético's Jack Reacher-like striker?
content: Alexander Sørloth can haunt Barça again and send Atlético top of LaLiga when the sides meet on Tuesday.

title: Allende outshines Messi as Miami book spot vs. Vancouver
content: Tadeo Allende's performance of a lifetime, and the own goal that broke San Diego hearts. Cesar Hernandez and Joseph Lowery to sum up the best and worst of MLS' conference finals as Inter Miami book a date with Vancouver.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Nusa move
content: Barcelona will look to sign RB Leipzig and Norway winger Antonio Nusa. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Sanchar Saathi: DoT order to phone makers to ‘pre-install’ app gets significant pushback
content: Rajya Sabha MP Priyanka Chaturvedi from the Shiv Sena (UBT) said “Sanchar Saathi mobile app mandate by the GoI is nothing but another BIG BOSS surveillance moment”

title: Kharge, Sonia, Rahul, other Opposition MPs protest against SIR in Parliament complex
content: Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, DMK’s K. Kanhimozhi and T.R. Baalu were among the Opposition leaders protesting in front of Parliament’s Makar Dwar

title: New passenger pick-up rules at Bengaluru airport to come into effect from December 8
content: The enhanced pick-up measures are expected to streamline passenger movement, reduce congestion, and improve safety, discipline, and overall convenience at arrival areas

title: Eleven arrested; trawler seized for illegal fishing in turtle habitation zones in Odisha's Gahirmatha
content: The marine fishermen, who hail from Kendrapara district, were sent to judicial custody after their arrest December 1

title: Supreme Court to resume hearing on SIR: LIVE
content: Election Commission of India, in separate affidavits in the Supreme Court, submitted that 95.65% of electors in Tamil Nadu and 99.77% in West Bengal have already been supplied with pre-filled enumeration forms

title: Remand prisoner found dead with throat slit in Kannur Central Jail in Kerala
content: The Wayanad native was in jail after being accused of murdering his wife. Police have registered a case of unnatural death

title: Tamil Nadu woman killed in bus accident in Karnataka; four injured rushed to Madanapalle hospital
content: According to the police, the bus, which was enroute to Bengaluru from Kadapa, hit the median around 4 a.m., and overturned

title: Vijayawada MP thank Civil Aviation Minister for permitting ‘Irumudis’ on flights
content: Vijayawada MP Sivanath also urged the Civil Aviation minister to run Vijayawada-Dubai direct flight, as many people from Andhra Pradesh are living in Dubai

title: Six flights cancelled at Chennai airport citing operational reasons
content: Flights to destinations including Guwahati, Jaipur, Bhubaneswar, Kochi and Mumbai, were cancelled by the airlines due to operational reasons, AAI said

title: Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar hold Round 2 of breakfast meeting at latter’s residence in Bengaluru
content: Though the meeting was largely seen as a ‘courtesy call’, the CM’s visit to the Deputy CM’s residence is believed to have brought Mr. Shivakumar to the centre stage of Karnataka politics

title: BJP has not prioritised cultural heritage: Archaeologist K.K. Muhammed
content: “When the BJP had come to power, we had expected that there would be qualitative and quantitative change as far as protection, conservation and excavation of sites was concerned, but that has not happened,” archaeologist K.K. Muhammed said

title: IndiGo flight from Kuwait to Hyderabad diverted to Mumbai after hoax bomb threat
content: An email warning of an explosive device was sent to the GMR airport authorities at around 5.15 a.m., prompting the immediate diversion of the flight 6E1234

title: Delhi riots case hearing LIVE: Delhi Police’s ‘regime change’ claim absent from chargesheet, accused tell SC
content: Umar Khalid, other accused are seeking bail after five years in jail as undertrials; Delhi police say violence was pre-planned

title: Parliament Winter session Day 2 LIVE updates: FM Sitharaman to move Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025 for passing
content: The first day of the Winter session witnessed repeated adjournments of the Lok Sabha and an Opposition walkout from the Rajya Sabha over demand for a debate on Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls

title: Kerala local body polls: Rebel trouble haunts UDF in its Kannur stronghold
content: Rebel candidates are in the fray against both Congress and IUML nominees in the Corporation, prompting the latter to take disciplinary action against four activists. CPI(M) is presenting a team of new faces from diverse professional backgrounds, while the BJP has given priority to women candidates

title: Kerala local body polls: CPI(M) plays second fiddle to Kerala Congress (M) in Catholic heartland
content: In several seats across Central Travancore, CPI(M) is contesting without its iconic election symbol, while KC(M), despite being the junior partner, retains its ‘two leaves’ symbol everywhere. Though CPI(M) terms it a move to appear inclusive, local leaders say voters in the Christian belt are unlikely to support the party symbol

title: Kerala local body polls: Will Sabarimala present a ‘golden’ opportunity for Congress, BJP?
content: Ground-level reactions indicate a mixed and often a muted response, with many voters prioritising everyday concerns over religious controversies. As parties ramp up their campaigns, the actual impact of the Sabarimala issue on the election remains uncertain.

title: Maharashtra CM expresses displeasure over the last-minute decision to postpone elections in some constituencies
content: Calling delay in elections “injustice towards candidates, Mr. Fadnavis said, “Due to revision, the campaigning efforts of the party workers for last 20 to 25 days has gone into vain.”

title: Congress Govt’s rigorous enforcement of PIT-NDPS Act has yielded significant results in combating drug menace: Himachal CM
content: The Chief Minister announced a reward to be provided to those giving information about those involved in ‘chitta’ business

title: Maharashtra local body polls first phase: 7.94% voting recorded in first two hours
content: Nearly one crore voters are eligible to exercise their franchise in the first round of the multi-tier rural and urban local bodies elections

title: Winter Session of M.P. Assembly begins with protests over cough syrup tragedy, short duration of session
content: The four-day-long session began with members paying their condolences to various people, including film actor and former Lok Sabha MP Dharmendra, former Union Minister Shriprakash Jaiswal, and the victims of the explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort

title: BJP demands audit of 1.25 crore entries made in SIR across three days in West Bengal
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari claimed that between 26-28 November, digitisation figures of enumeration forms jumped from 5.5 crore to 6.75 crore, an abnormal and statistically impossible jump of 1.25 crore entries within just three days.

title: Indian armed forces to procure more satellite-linked Heron Mk II UAVs under emergency procurement
content: Army and Air Force, which already operate Heron Mk II drones, have placed additional orders while the Indian Navy is acquiring them for the first time, says official

title: Plea in Indore court seeks FIR against IAS Santosh Verma over controversial remarks
content: Shailendra Dwivedi, an Indore-based lawyer, filed a plea before the Judicial Magistrate First Class seeking directions for the police to register an FIR against IAS Santosh Verma while alleging that his statement was “vulgar, obscene and cheap”

title: Abhishek refutes allegations of contesting 2026 Assembly polls from Nandigram
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari once again challenged the Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to contest from Bhabanipur

title: New HIV cases highest in Mizoram; fresh infections drop nationally by 48% from 2010-2024: report
content: Annual AIDS-related mortality rate per 1,00,000 population estimated nationally at 2.32, with Manipur topping the list, says the India HIV estimate 2025 technical report

title: Delhi blast probe: NIA searches nine locations in Jammu and Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh
content: The NIA said that “various digital devices and other incriminating materials were seized” from the “premises of several accused and suspects in the two States”

title: Finally Lottulodukku and Gulgulmaal win something, albeit on a cricket turf
content: Over 50 regular local cricketers, split into eight teams, decided to get creative with team names for the seventh edition of their locally held tournament at a turf in Kochi

title: Can Paravur break with the past by ending political deadlock?
content: Amid intense competition between LDF and UDF for control of the 32-ward municipality, the NDA aims at gaining ground and influencing the formation of the ruling council in case of a tie.

title: Modi promises ‘all possible support’ for ailing Khaleda Zia
content: A five-member delegation of Chinese doctors has reached Bangladesh to assist the team supervising the former Prime Minister’s treatment at a hospital in Dhaka

title: Women candidates should prioritise provision of clean public toilets this campaign season, says public health expert
content: This is a basic health requirement which finds little or no mention in the election manifestos of even major political parties, says former Kerala University V-C B. Ekbal

title: Kuki-Zo Council objects to ‘renewed attempts’ to implement law taking away tribal chiefs’ land rights
content: “The very notion that a non-tribal organisation is proposing fundamental changes to tribal land governance highlights deep disregard for tribal rights,” says Kuki-Zo Council

title: HC directs robust sea wall along Edavanakkad coast
content: This followed a plea by residents of the area who pointed out that the panchayat has a coastal shore of approximately 2.4 kms, which is vulnerable to sea and soil erosion

title: PM Modi calls Sri Lankan President to offer continued support with cyclone relief
content: As part of Operation Sagar Bandhu, nationals of Sri Lanka, India, Germany, Slovenia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Poland, Belarus, Iran, Australia, Pakistan and Bangladesh have been rescued

title: Tirupparankundram temple management can light lamp at Deepathoon: High Court
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan says Deepathoon is located at a lower peak at a distance of not less than 50 metres from the mosque. It is in the unoccupied portion and belongs exclusively to the temple

title: SIR 2.0: Election Commission dismisses allegations of ‘mass disenfranchisement’
content: The poll body tells Supreme Court that 95.65% of electors in Tamil Nadu and 99.77% in West Bengal have already been supplied with pre-filled enumeration forms

title: Number of government schools falls, but those with fewer than 10 students see a steady rise
content: Data tabled in Parliament reveals that the number of teachers employed at such schools rose from 1.26 lakh in 2022-23 to 1.44 lakh in 2024-25

title: Nine major bank fraud accused among 15 fugitive economic offenders: govt.
content: Since June 2014, 120 people have been convicted under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, Ministry tells Lok Sabha

title: Role of Coimbatore gang-rape accused suspected in herder’s murder
content: The body of the victim, M. Devaraj, 55, of Kurumbapalayam near Muthugoundenpudur, was found with blunt injuries at Serayampalayam on November 6

title: Chennai and its neighbouring districts may get heavy rain on December 2
content: The Regional Meteorological Centre says the deep depression, a remnant of Cyclone Ditwah, is likely to move northwards parallel to the north Tamil Nadu and south A.P. coasts over the next six hours

title: Priyanka slams Modi, says raising issues of people is not ‘drama’
content: “The Prime Minister says, ‘enjoy the weather’. What weather should the people of Delhi enjoy? At least take a peek outside to see what is happening in the country,” Ms. Vadra said.

title: On the first day of Winter Session, Opposition walks out over SIR
content: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said all Opposition floor leaders had met at his chamber and decided to raise the issue of Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in one voice

title: CBI officer assesses progress of probe into Karur stampede
content: CBI Deputy Inspector-General of Police Atul Kumar Thakur visits  the scene of stampede and studies the area. He also holds spot consultations with CBI officials camping in Karur for carrying out the investigation

title: Senior BJP leader Prem Kumar all set to become Speaker of Bihar Assembly
content: He is expected to get elected unopposed since no other candidate has filed nomination papers for the post

title: Third edition of BLR Hubba to begin on January 16
content: Aiming to position Bengaluru on the global cultural map, the 10-day event will feature over 250 performances across more than 12 genres, including international acts from Japan and Malaysia and a special appearance by guitar legend Marty Friedman

title: Radhakrishnan urged to be impartial as he chairs first Rajya Sabha session
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hails Vice-President’s rise from humble origins as a testament to Indian democracy; Mallikarjun Kharge’s reference to Jagdeep Dhankhar’s sudden exit sparks furore

title: Renewable, low-carbon systems to fuel TG clean-energy powerhouse vision
content: Hyderabad will have largest electric bus fleet by 2030, internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles will not be sold after 2039

title: Bengaluru Central Corporation targets major commercial establishments for tax evasion
content: While the current drive focuses only on commercial establishments, the corporation may take up residential property verification in the future

title: ‘Congress govt. planning ₹82,000 crore burden on people with new thermal power projects’
content: BRS leader Harish Rao questions the rationale in going for new plants when NTPC is offering energy at a competitive price from Telangana-dedicated project

title: Suraj Lama case: Kerala HC seeks details from hospital
content: HC also directs the Superintendent of the Government Medical College, Kalamassery, where he was reportedly admitted, to submit reports on his medical history

title: Ministers brave rain to distribute NTR Bharosa pensions in South Coastal A.P.
content: Pensions worth ₹34,000 crore are being provided to 68 lakh people across the State and 90% of pensions are distributed in a single day, says MA&UD Minister

title: New HIV infections going up steadily in 15-24 year group in Kerala
content: 62.6% of the  individuals who contracted HIV in the past three years in Kerala got the infection through unsafe heterosexual sex involving multiple partners

title: Delhi HC slams Centre for failing to hold Cantonment Boards’ elections
content: “Special notifications could only be issued on special occasions, such as a military operation, and the government’s act might be seen as misuse of its powers,” says Delhi High Court Bench

title: Indian Army successfully conducts combat launch of BrahMos supersonic cruise missile
content: The missile demonstrated high-speed flight stability and terminal precision, striking its designated target accurately

title: OSR lands cannot be converted into housing plots by giving retrospective effect to new rules: Madras High Court
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq hold that any reduction in OSR requirements could be made applicable only prospectively

title: LPS 2: Amaravati farmers expect better package, time-bound fulfilment of promises
content: They justify their demands claiming that their land commands a higher value and citing the delay in the development of returnable plots acquired under LPS 1, and slow progress of capital works

title: Lok Sabha passes Manipur GST Bill amid disruptions over SIR
content: The Bill replaces an Ordinance which implemented reforms in Goods and Services Tax in Manipur; statutory resolution moved by Revolutionary Socialist Party member N.K. Premachandran disapproving the Bill was rejected by a voice vote

title: Rahul Easwar remanded; police seize laptop
content: Thiruvananthapuram Cyber Police book him under various Sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, along with provisions of the Information Technology Act

title: Bengaluru Police launch ‘Friends of Police’ drive, reach 2 lakh students in a day
content: As many as 800 police personnel, including Police Commissioner, participated in an exercise aimed at strengthening community policing and youth participation in crime prevention

title: Parliament Winter Session Live Updates: Opposition MPs Called To Speaker's Office After SIR Uproar In Lok Sabha
content: Winter Session Live Updates: The Winter Session of Parliament started on Monday and is expected go on till December 19. The first day of the session in the Lok Sabha saw repeated sloganeering by opposition MPs alleging electoral fraud.

title: Rs 62,944 Crore Debt, Rotting Grain: Madhya Pradesh Admits To Food Supply Failure
content: Experts say the corporation's condition has reached a breaking point where its financial instability, collapsing storage systems, and the precarious position of farmers and poor consumers are symptoms of a deeper policy paralysis.

title: Drone Pics On Delhi Blast Co-Conspirator's Phone Reveal A Hamas Pattern
content: The investigators found dozens of pictures and videos of drones and rocket launchers in the deleted folder of Danish's phone, according to the sources.

title: DK Shivakumar Hosts Siddaramaiah For Breakfast 2.0, Nati Chicken On Menu
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah met his deputy, DK Shivakumar, for a 'power breakfast' Tuesday morning, a meeting between the state's two most important leaders that under any other circumstances might have seem normal.

title: Meet Amar Subramanya, Apple's New Vice President Of AI
content: Arun Subramanya will report to Apple's software chief Craig Federighi, who oversees key areas, including foundation models, machine-learning research, search and knowledge and AI infrastructure.

title: China, Japan In Fresh Incident Around Disputed Islands
content: The Japanese-administered Senkaku Islands, known as the Diaoyu in China, have been a regular flashpoint between the two nations over the decades.

title: Jagan Reddy Spent Rs 222 Crore On Air Travel In 5 Years As Chief Minister
content: The Andhra Pradesh Aviation Corporation Ltd (APACL) spent a whopping Rs 222.85 crore on air travel during former Chief Minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy's tenure from 2019 to 2024, newly disclosed records show.

title: Sanchar Saathi Explained: What It Is And Why It Is Being Made Mandatory
content: Sanchar Saath's purpose is to help mobile users manage their digital identity, report suspicious activity, and safeguard their devices.

title: Big Row Over Centre's Sanchar Saathi Directive To Phonemakers
content: A massive political row has erupted over the Centre's direction to mobile phone manufacturers to install the Sanchar Saathi mobile app in all handsets manufactured or imported in India

title: World Listens To PM Modi As India Displays Its Strength Where Needed: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has said world leaders listen carefully when Prime Minister Narendra Modi speaks and this is happening because India's strength is getting manifested and the country is finding its rightful place.

title: India Moves To Procure More Heron MK-II Drones Post Operation Sindoor
content: India has initiated the procurement of more Israeli Heron MK-II drones under emergency provisions invoked after Operation Sindoor, according to sources in the Israeli defence industry.

title: A 1989 Kidnapping Case And The Release Of 5 Terrorists
content: On December 8, 1989, Rubaiya Sayeed, daughter of then Union Home Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed was kidnapped on her way back home from a hospital in Srinagar. She was kidnapped by terrorists affiliated with the JKLF.

title: UP District Topper Dies By Suicide Hours Before Class 12 Pre-Board Exam
content: A 17-year-old student who had topped his district in the 2023 class 10 board examinations allegedly committed suicide, just hours before he was to appear for his class 12 physics pre-board exam, police said.

title: Telangana Nursing Student Attacked With Chemical Substance, Suffers Injuries
content: A nursing student in Telangana's Warangal district was attacked with a chemical substance by three unidentified individuals. According to the police, the incident occurred in the district's Kazipet Mandal area on Monday evening.

title: Disha Patani's Sister Helps Accident Victims, Flags Ambulance Delay In Video
content: Bollywood actor Disha Patani's sister, Khushboo Patani, has raised pointed questions about emergency response failures after she stopped to help victims of a fatal road accident on the Delhi-Lucknow Highway.

title: Why IPS Officers Holding IAS Posts? High Court Asks Telangana To Explain
content: The Telangana High Court has issued notices to the state government, seeking an explanation regarding the appointment of Indian Police Service officers to several key administrative positions designated for the Indian Administrative Service cadre.

title: Rawalpindi Braces For Mega Protest By Imran Khan Supporters, Gatherings Banned
content: Amid continued rumours about the death of former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and fears of unrest, the government has imposed Section 144 in Rawalpindi, banning public gatherings. The move comes amid planned protests by Khan's PTI demanding access to him.

title: Chennai Metro Train Stuck In Subway, Commuters Forced To Walk Through Tunnel
content: The train got stuck in a subway between the Central Metro and High Court station. Passengers on board complained of no electricity.

title: Activist Rahul Easwar Gets 14-Day Judicial Custody In Kerala MLA Rape Case
content: A court on Monday dismissed the bail petition of activist Rahul Easwar and remanded him to judicial custody for allegedly defaming the complainant in the sexual assault case against MLA Rahul Mamkoottathil.

title: Hyderabad Metro Gets 20 Transgender Security Personnel
content: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) has announced the induction of 20 transgender personnel into its frontline security services, in what is seen as a major step toward social empowerment and enhanced commuter security.

title: 'A man of the people': Caleb Williams and more of NFL Week 13's top quotes
content: this week was a good reminder that some of the game's best moments come from what's said before and after the whistle . players and coaches carried their teams' momentum from the field to the podium . the Bears had plenty to celebrate after downing the Philadelphia Eagles 24-15 .

title: NFL Week 14 odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers
content: the Dallas Cowboys visit the Detroit Lions as underdogs on "Thursday Night Football" the cowboys have back-to-back wins over the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs . the Lions are coming off a loss at home to the Green Bay Packers .

title: Will there be baseball in 2027? Is a salary cap coming? What you need to know about MLB's looming labor battle﻿
content: the league's current labor agreement expires on Dec. 1, 2026 . there are major hurdles to clear and some key areas of disagreement . a lockout would shut down free agency and trades, as it did in 2021 .

title: Lane Kiffin, Thanksgiving and CFB conference champs: A busy weekend at sportsbooks
content: oddsmakers think Lane Kiffin's departure from Ole Miss triggered a guessing game at sportsbooks . the mercurial coach will not be heading into the college football playoff . oddsmakers say he's worth upwards of four points .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe . there are now nine schools looking for head coaches: UCLA, Cal, and now Michigan State .

title: MLB offseason grades: Reliever Devin Williams joins Mets after rough season with Yankees
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Texas Tech into top five
content: coach's prolonged employment decision didn't really qualify as surprising for those who have followed his career . Trinidad Chambliss was one of the season's most delightful surprises . he finished the regular season with 3,016 passing yards and 18 touchdowns .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the résumés are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Big win, better trolls: Panthers poke fun at Rams after upset
content: the Carolina Panthers beat the los Angeles Rams 31-28 at home . it marked the fourth quarter's seventh upset victory of the season . the Panthers posted a photo of a "W" shaved onto a Ram .

title: Drake Maye strengthens MVP case against Giants; Patriots win 10th straight
content: the new England Patriots beat the visiting new york Giants 33-15 on Monday night . Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 282 yards with two touchdowns and no interceptions . the Patriots won their 10th straight game to improve to an NFL-best 11-2 and enter their week 14 bye week .

title: Kentucky names Oregon OC Stein as next HC
content: "this is truly a dream come true," will Stein says in a statement . "i could only dream of one day leading the Wildcats," he says . he will remain in his role as Oregon's offensive coordinator and playcaller .

title: Takeaways: Top AFC seed for Broncos? Panthers are legit?
content: the Bears extended their win streak to five games with a decisive win over the Eagles on black Friday . the 49ers trimmed the Rams' NFC West lead by a dominant victory over the Browns . Tampa Bay broke its three-game losing streak, the Dolphins won their third straight .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .
